title: Student Learning Improvement Strategies Through Teacher Collaboration: A Comparative Analysis-Based Project Learning Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Basic mathematical concepts and fundamental job-related competencies
context.additional_context: Course analyzing teacher collaboration cases in digital environments, establishing mathematics learning improvement strategies, and applying them to real projects

learning_goals: Learners derive at least three student-centered mathematics learning strategies by analyzing teacher collaboration systems.
Learners design and apply collaborative competency enhancement plans to PBL based on international comparative cases (Hong Kong/Singapore).
Learners develop and validate a learner-customized feedback system using formative assessment data.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
